p.s: Of course I can help you with your presentation about unusual school projects worldwide.
I came across an article that I think would be helpful.
The article talks about chess as a subject at school, isn't that interesting?
Chess at school is actually getting quite popular.
There's a project in Bremen called Chess makes you smart I translated it for you and almost 2500 kids took part in it this year!
Every week they had one hour of chess lessons in their primary shcools.
But not only younger kids play chess at school: Atat one school 8th and 9th graders can play too if they want to.
In almost all schools that offer chess classes, they're voluntary.
But the article mentioned a primary school where it's a compulsory subject.
I was really surprised by that.
There seem to be so many benefits!
It is supposed to promote logical and strategical thinking and lead to a better concentration and a better connection between the students.
The students learn to think about the consequences of a decision, to stick to the rules and to accept a defeat.
In some schools all grades play chess together, showing younger or weaker kids that they can win over older, stronger kids.
There are also positive consequences for the general level of achievement and the social behaviour of the kids.
Wow, so many positive results.
Are you as surprised as I am?
Maybe I should start playing chess too!
Keep me updated about the presentation.
I'd love to hear from you!
